meanings.definition: A person who spreads fear or panic.
meanings.sent1: The alarmists in the movie made everyone believe a monster was hiding in the closet.
meanings.sent2: The alarmists on social media kept warning about a storm that never arrived.
meanings.sent3: The alarmists at the party joked that the cake was so spicy, it would set off the fire alarm.
meanings.sent4: The alarmists in the neighborhood painted a picture of a world constantly on the brink of disaster.
meanings.sent5: The alarmists in the story were like characters in a horror movie, always seeing danger where there was none.

meanings.definition: Those who exaggerate or overstate potential dangers.
meanings.sent1: The group of alarmists at school always made every small issue seem like a major crisis.
meanings.sent2: The alarmists in the community council meeting raised concerns about imaginary threats.
meanings.sent3: The alarmists at the picnic claimed the ants were plotting a takeover of the park.
meanings.sent4: The alarmists in the office saw every deadline as the end of the world.
meanings.sent5: The alarmists in the play were like actors in a comedy, turning minor mishaps into major catastrophes.
